H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H3277.def: = fairly large wild goat, with adults being about ninety centimeters high at the shoulder; for most of the year its color is grayish but it turns browner in winter; males have thick long horns over 130 centimeters in length which curve backwards in a semicircle; the horns of the females are much slimmer and shorter, reaching a length of only about 40 centimeters; only the last few centimeters of the horns are smooth, the rest being ringed with ridges; these animals live in small herds in the mountains and prefer cliffs and crags, where they live off the bushes that grow on the ledges; ► clean animal, so may be eaten

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H2342.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H3391.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H3766.def: = process by which humans or animals sink on their knees ◄ as a result of being unable to keep standing up

H6398.def: = causative action by which humans use a sharp implement to split an object, either partially or completely

H3206.def: = posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H2492.def: = process by which an animal becomes physically strong

H1250.def: aramaism: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H6501.def: = wild donkey of a relatively large size but with relatively small ears; it has a fawn color with a whitish chest and belly; ◄ Persian Wild Ass or Onager, Equus hemonius; ≈ associated with both untameable wildness and sexual desire

H2670.def: = state of not being under the control of someone else

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H6171.def: = wild donkey of a relatively small size with long ears and a tufted tail; has a light brown color with a dark stripe down its spine and across its shoulders, and stripes on the lower part of its forelegs; ◄ |iEquus africanus asinus|i* or Nubian Wild Ass; ≈ associated with freedom

H4147.def: = material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H4420.def: = land of which the soil contains a relatively high quantity of salt and other minerals that render it infertile

H4908.def: = location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H1995.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

H7151.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H8663.def: = action by which humans speak loudly

H5065.def: = a person who forces humans and animals to perform certain activities

H8446.def: = action by which humans carefully investigate a location

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H4829.def: = open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H7214.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = a wild, untamable animal with horns, and very strong; perhaps wild ox, buffalo, or rhinoceros; ≈ symbol of strength, wildness, and power

H14.def: = state in which someone is willing to do something

H5647.def: = state in which humans, either as individuals or as groups, are in a position of subservience towards (other) individuals or groups, which is normally accompanied by a number of duties, tasks and obligations

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H18.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = long container, ◄ made of wood or stone; ► used for putting food for one's domestic animals

H7194.def: = process by which separate objects being joined together to form one unit

H7214.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = a wild, untamable animal with horns, and very strong; perhaps wild ox, buffalo, or rhinoceros; ≈ symbol of strength, wildness, and power

H8525.def: = long, narrow trench made in the soil by a plow

H5688.def: = piece of cord or chain; ◄ made by twisting together strands of palm fibres, linen, reeds, or gold; ► used for tying and keeping things together

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7702.def: = causative action by which someone breaks the soil with the help of a plow, pulled by domestic animals; ► to make it ready for cultivation; ≈ usually regarded as a strenuous task which requires much energy

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H3018.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious work which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H1637.def: = level, circular area about 7.5 to 12 meters in diameter, where people threshed their grain; usually located near the fields where the grain was grown, and if possible, in an elevated area that was exposed to the breeze

H3671.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

H7443.def: = large bird with underdeveloped wings so that itcannot fly; it has a long neck and long legs and is about 2 meters tall; its head and neck are almost bald, being covered in short bristles; the male's body is black with long white feathers on its wings; its tail is white, gray, or light brown; the females are a uniform grayish brown; they feed mainly on seeds, fallen fruit, and shoots and may occasionally eat a lizard or a frog; they live in small flocks of about twenty, of which four or five are males; as many as ten females may lay their eggs in the one nest, but only one female and one male will incubate the eggs, with the female on the nest in the daytime, and the male taking over later in the afternoon; male ostriches make a series of deep booming hoots that can be heard great distances and which are often mistaken for the roar of a lion; ◄ |iStruthio camelus; |i*≈ associated with heartless cruelty because most females do not hatch their own eggs and do not take care of their own young

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H84.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird; ► used for flying but also for protecting its young; ≈ associated with safety and security

H5133.def: = the flat appendages growing on the skin of a bird, that consist of a shaft with vanes of barbs extending from it

H2624.def: = large bird with long legs and a long neck; the white stork has a white body and black wings, whereas the black stork is a glossy brownish black color with a white belly; both varieties have a red beak and legs; both types spend most of the time on the ground or in shallow water searching for food; the white stork eats mainly locusts, grasshoppers, and other insects, as well as frogs, lizards, and the chicks of ground-nesting birds, whereas the black stork prefers fish and frogs but also eats the same things as the white stork; ◄ |iCiconia ciconia|i* or |iCiconia nigra|i*; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H1000.def: = an oval or round object coming from the body of a female bird or reptile and containing an ovum which, if fertilized, can develop into a new organism; ≈ appreciated as food

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2552.def: = process by which human or inanimate objects feel or become warm or hot

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2115.def: = causative action by which someone applies pressure to a wound to remove pus and other liquids

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H1758.def: = causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression

H7188.def: literally: to harden someone else's heart; = causative action by which deities cause humans to be stubborn and unwilling to yield

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H6343.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H3018.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious work which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H7385.def: = state in which a container does not contain anything

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5382.def: = action when one is no longer able to remember or recall a person or a past experience

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H4754.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler to which they had formerly been subjected

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H7392.def: = action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>} or a {L:horse<SDBH:סוּס>} or in a {L:chariot<SDBH:מֶרְכָּבָה>}

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

16.gl: to clothe (someone with a certain state)

H697.def: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten

H367.def: = state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death

H1935.def: = state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority

H2658.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H7797.def: poetic term; = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7122.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H5402.def: = class of tools designed to attack and inflict bodily harm on someone else or to defend oneself against similar attacks from other people

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H6343.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H2865.def: = state in which the surface of the soil is broken into many pieces

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H827.def: = long, narrow container ► for storing one's arrows

H2595.def: = a long, straight rod, usually made of wood, with a sharp {L:iron<SDBH:בַּרְזֶל>} head or point; used for piercing by thrusting; its length varied from the height of a man to much longer

H3591.def: = a type of short {L:spear<SDBH:רֹמַח>} or large {L:arrow<SDBH:חֵץ>}, made of wood or reed, and therefore relatively light and more suited for throwing from a standing position or while riding on a horse or in a chariot

H7267.def: = state in which the body of humans and animals shakes involuntarily, ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, excitement, or other emotions

H1572.def: = action by which someone consumes something, by eating or drinking

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H7782.def: = a musical instrument ◄ made from a ram's horn; ► sound is produced by blowing into the small end; ► used for giving signals and during festivals and celebrations

H1767.def: = state of being sufficient in quantity for a given purpose

H7782.def: = a musical instrument ◄ made from a ram's horn; ► sound is produced by blowing into the small end; ► used for giving signals and during festivals and celebrations

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H8643.def: = loud sound ◄ produced either by the human voice or by musical instruments ► used to express an emotion or to communicate something to a community

H5322.def: = flowers on a tree or bush

H82.def: = to move through the air with the help of wings

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H6566.def: = causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically

H3671.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

H8486.def: = area located to the south of a point of reference

H5404.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle

H1361.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7064.def: = structure, made by birds ◄ from twigs, straw, grass, or other materials, ► to lay their eggs and shelter their young; ≈ associated with security

H2658.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H400.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2491.def: = state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object
